message: I tried using the Django ORM from a separate thread. Quickly, I found out that the thread finished, but the DB connection was kept alive. After a while, my DB ran out of DB connections.
I tried seeking more info on this topic, but found mostly questions. So, what's the right way of doing this?  Should I explicitly close the connection? How?
but you probably want to maintain a connection pool
Thanks. I ended up going through the source code and found it. I'm really surprised Django doesn’t use some sort of connection pool itself.
